O fluxograma do registro de ocorrências do NOC detalha o procedimento padrão,
começando pela detecção de uma nova ocorrência ou atualização de falhas nas comunicações
operacionais, que deve ser imediatamente lançada no relatório do turno de serviço (eletrônico),]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/veRZWGTjK8zPeDaHgFUKvh/PoC-IA-NOC--.pdf?pdfPage=8
Pages: 8,9
- resistência à mudança: eventualmente pode haver resistência de membros da
Polícia Militar em adaptar-se às novas tecnologias, métodos de trabalho introduzidos e sobre o
conceito de quais dados podem e devem ser objeto de transparência. Isso pode afetar a eficácia
da implementação e a aceitação.
FL. 9
- dependência tecnológica e falhas: a PoC depende fortemente de tecnologia
avançada, como a IA para análise de dados, estruturados ou não. Falhas técnicas, erros de
software ou problemas de hardware podem comprometer a eficácia da POC.
- limitações na qualidade dos dados: a qualidade e a abrangência dos dados podem
não ser suficientes para uma análise efetiva, levando a insights imprecisos ou incompletos.
- custo e orçamento: há o risco da PoC exceder o orçamento planejado, seja por
custos não previstos com tecnologia, pessoal ou outros recursos necessários para a execução
eficaz do projeto.
- questões legais e de conformidade: A PoC deve estar em conformidade com as leis]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/veRZWGTjK8zPeDaHgFUKvh/PoC-IA-NOC--.pdf?pdfPage=4
Pages: 4,5
denominado data lake3.
3
Data Lake é uma solução de armazenamento que permite a reunião de grandes quantidades de dados em formatos
variados. Ao contrário de um data warehouse, que armazena dados em um formato estruturado e processado, o data
lake mantém os dados em seu estado bruto. Essa abordagem oferece maior flexibilidade e eficiência para análises de
dados complexas e variadas, fundamentais em ambientes operacionais como o da PMESP.
FL. 5
Tal unificação facilitará o acesso aos dados brutos em seus formatos originais, como
fotografias, áudios, vídeos e textos, tornando-os prontamente disponíveis para os usuários do
sistema Oráculo. Além disso, essa configuração será fundamental para a aplicação eficaz de
técnicas de Inteligência Artificial (IA) em análises avançadas e na geração de predições,
otimizando a interpretação e o uso desses dados em contextos operacionais.
A(s) pessoa(s) interessada(s) poderá(ão) participar mesmo que não tenha(m)]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/veRZWGTjK8zPeDaHgFUKvh/PoC-IA-NOC--.pdf?pdfPage=3
Pages: 3,4
integração sinérgica e análise detalhada de dados provenientes de sistemas distintos e
especializados: o sistema Zabbix, destinado ao monitoramento da infraestrutura de
radiocomunicação; o sistema Cherwell, focado na gestão de chamados; e o sistema de
videomonitoramento posicionado nos sites de radiocomunicação. Este projeto visa estabelecer
uma perspectiva unificada e abrangente sobre as operações e incidentes relacionados à
FL. 4
radiocomunicação, objetivando um avanço significativo na eficiência e eficácia na administração
e na resposta a eventos críticos, essenciais para a manutenção da segurança e efetividade das
comunicações operacionais.
A integração destes sistemas não somente aumentará a eficiência operacional, mas
também melhorará a qualidade da análise de dados, permitindo que a PMESP antecipe e
responda proativamente a situações de emergência e falhas do sistema de radiocomunicação. Isso]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/veRZWGTjK8zPeDaHgFUKvh/PoC-IA-NOC--.pdf?pdfPage=3
Pages: 3
capturadas por estas câmeras aos demais dados operacionais, é possível obter uma visão mais
completa e detalhada dos eventos ocorridos nos locais monitorados. Esta abordagem enriquece
significativamente a vigilância, permitindo um monitoramento mais eficaz dos sítios e uma
análise mais acurada das situações. Essa melhoria não só fortalece a proteção da infraestrutura
crítica de radiocomunicação, mas também amplia a segurança dos policiais em serviço e da
comunidade como um todo, oferecendo uma resposta mais rápida e informada a eventuais
ameaças ou emergências.
O Projeto Oráculo, portanto, é uma iniciativa ousada que busca transformar a maneira
como a PMESP utiliza a tecnologia para melhorar a segurança pública. Ao unificar diferentes
fontes de dados e aplicar análises avançadas e inteligentes, a PMESP não só se adapta às
demandas de um mundo digitalizado, mas também se coloca à frente na utilização de tecnologias]"]

O documento do "Projeto Oráculo" detalha os requisitos específicos de inteligência artificial (IA) exigidos para a prova de conceito (PoC). Aqui estão os pontos chave relacionados aos requisitos de IA mencionados no documento:

1. **Desenvolvimento de Funcionalidades de IA**:
   - A PoC incluirá o desenvolvimento de uma funcionalidade de IA para a vinculação automática de alertas do sistema Zabbix a chamados no Cherwell existentes. Esta IA será capaz de identificar e correlacionar os alertas de falha do Zabbix com os chamados relevantes no Cherwell, garantindo uma gestão integrada e eficiente .
   - A IA também será utilizada para identificar locais de radiocomunicação nos textos dos campos do Cherwell, superando a ausência de um campo estruturado para esta finalidade .

2. **Assistente Virtual por Voz**:
   - A implementação de um assistente virtual por voz que, ao ser acionado pela palavra-chave "Oráculo", estará pronto para receber perguntas relacionadas à base de dados integrada prevista para a PoC e outros dados da base original da IA .

3. **Tabelas Auxiliares**:
   - A PoC considerará o uso de tabelas auxiliares, por sugestão das pessoas envolvidas ou dos militares, como informações sobre a condição do tempo, que podem impactar a qualidade e disponibilidade da radiocomunicação. Esses dados adicionais enriquecerão as análises e permitirão um entendimento mais completo dos fatores que influenciam as comunicações operacionais da PMESP .

4. **Criação de Chamados Automáticos com Análise Contextual**:
   - A PoC explorará a criação automática de chamados no Cherwell com base na configuração de alertas pré-configurados no Zabbix. Esses chamados incluirão análises contextuais, utilizando o histórico de alertas do Zabbix e as tratativas anteriores no Cherwell para uma intervenção mais direcionada e eficaz .

5. **Funcionalidade e Precisão do Chatbot e do Assistente por Voz**:
   - Incluirá a avaliação da habilidade de compreender e responder a consultas em linguagem natural, bem como a precisão e relevância das análises fornecidas pelo chatbot e assistente por voz .

6. **Automatização de Alertas e Chamados**:
   - A eficiência da IA em vincular automaticamente os alertas do Zabbix aos chamados no Cherwell, incluindo a capacidade de identificar automaticamente os sites de radiocomunicação através do processamento de linguagem natural .

Esses requisitos de IA são fundamentais para o sucesso do "Projeto Oráculo", visando aprimorar a eficiência operacional, a gestão de incidentes e a tomada de decisões estratégicas na PMESP através da integração e análise avançada de dados.
o sistema Zabbix e Cherwell sao proprietários de quais empresas ?

O sistema Zabbix é um software de código aberto, desenvolvido e mantido pela Zabbix LLC, uma empresa baseada na Europa. Ele é utilizado para monitoramento de rede, servidores, infraestrutura de TI e serviços de nuvem, oferecendo recursos de coleta de dados, visualização e alerta em tempo real.

O Cherwell Service Management é um produto da Cherwell Software, LLC, uma empresa sediada nos Estados Unidos. O Cherwell é uma plataforma de gestão de serviços de TI (ITSM) que oferece automação e gerenciamento de serviços de TI, permitindo às organizações melhorar a eficiência dos serviços de TI e a satisfação do cliente.

Ambos os sistemas são utilizados por organizações em todo o mundo para melhorar a operação, o monitoramento e a gestão de serviços e infraestruturas de TI.

metadata_list.text: Tips and best practices: The permission to manage API tokens is granted/revoked in the user role settings. Use the principle of least privilege when defining access rights. Create a unique token for each integration and reveal the value only to the service that needs it. Treat token value just as any other sensitive information: store it in a ...

metadata_list.title: AWS monitoring and integration with Zabbix
metadata_list.text: This script checks availability of AWS EC2 instances in Zabbix, and if they do not exist in default AWS region (because of termination for ex.), they will be removed from Zabbix. This python module provides Zabbix monitoring support for AWS resources. Script for zabbix send e-mails notifications using AWS SES.

metadata_list.title: Kubernetes monitoring and integration with Zabbix
metadata_list.text: User guide to setting up Zabbix monitoring of the Kubernetes. A template set for monitoring your Kubernetes cluster via Zabbix 6.4 and higher. Zabbix provides a powerful automated solution for monitoring the Kubernetes cluster components. You need to deploy Zabbix Helm Chart with Zabbix Proxy and Zabbix agents to monitor the cluster.

metadata_list.title: Microsoft Teams monitoring and integration with Zabbix
metadata_list.text: First, you need to get a webhook URL for the channel. There are two ways to do this: Add official Zabbix webhook connector from MS Teams apps for the channel, where you want to receive notifications. (Check how to add a connector to a channel) Create Incoming webhook for your channel. (See Teams documentation for the step-by-step instructions).

metadata_list.title: OpsGenie monitoring and integration with Zabbix
metadata_list.text: Having successfully sent a request from Zabbix, check if it is received in Opsgenie alert panel (it may require refreshing). To close this problem from Zabbix, change event.value to 0 (it indicates a recovery event) on the test page and press Test button again to send the problem close request. Confirm that problem is closed in Opsgenie panel.

# Zabbix Integration

Monitoring consolidation - eliminate event storms, reduce MTTR using Zabbix hosts data and problems in Dynatrace leveraging Davis AI engine.

Technology by Alanata 

Get started【0†Documentation†alanata.atlassian.net】

[Image 6][Image 7][Image 8][Image 9][Image 10]

arrow-left 

  * Product information 

arrow-right 

## Overview 

Consolidate and integrate your monitoring tools. Alanata Zabbix Integration enables you to connect existing Zabbix monitoring into Dynatrace. Enrich Dynatrace SmartScape with Zabbix hosts, ingest Zabbix problems, and let Davis AI engine process the problems together with native Dynatrace events in an integrated AIOps solution. With this extension, you can use Dynatrace as a unifying platform for data from external monitoring solutions, eliminate event storms, and minimize the effort spent on the investigation.

## Key Features

  * Synchronization
    * Zabbix hosts from monitored groups to Dynatrace custom devices. Extension handles

overlapping of Dynatrace OneAgent and Zabbix * Zabbix Hosts information to Dynatrace Custom devices metadata. This includes Zabbix inventory, IP/Hostname information and other metadata configurable in the extension settings * Host TCP port discovery based on Zabbix items (net.tcp.service, net.tcp.port, net.tcp.listen) * Optional host multiple IP interface discovery (Zabbix template must be added to the Zabbix instance) * Tag synchronization from Zabbix to Dynatrace * Problem data from Zabbix problems to Dynatrace events, including acknowledge information and other properties

  * Filtering

    * Filtering based on host groups
  * Problem metric

    * Metric showing problem count for each device (optional)
  * Context information

    * Dynatrace Environment URL to link Hosts/Custom Devices and problems in Dynatrace with Zabbix hosts and problems

## Resources

【0†Documentation†alanata.atlassian.net】

content.text:
* The ProxyConfigFrequency parameter is now used in both Zabbix server (for passive mode) and Zabbix proxy (for active mode) configuration files
  * ConfigFrequency parameter in Zabbix proxy configuration is now deprecated
  * Default ProxyConfigFrequency parameter is 10 seconds (down from 1 hour)

This also improves the performance of Zabbix servers and proxies, since only configuration deltas are synced. As for active agents – the active agent receives a full configuration copy only when any changes are detected in the configuration instead of receiving it every RefreshActiveChecks interval (old behavior)

### New SNMP walk item for bulk collection and discovery of SNMP metrics 

A new SNMP agent walk item has been introduced. The item looks at a specified OID or OIDs and polls their indexes by suing the SNMP GetBulk requests. An SNMP GetBulk request can provide better performance and more rapid metric collection and discovery from enterprise-tier SNMP devices.

For example:

    walk[1.3.6.1.1,1.3.6.2]

Result:

    1.3.6.1.2.1.1 = STRING: "<value1>"
    1.3.6.1.2.1.2 = STRING: "<value2>"
    1.3.6.1.2.1.3 = STRING: "<value3>"
    1.3.6.2.1 = INTEGER: 10
    1.3.6.2.2 = INTEGER: 20

Textual values can then be transformed to JSON, which can serve as a master item for low-level discovery rules:

[Image 8]SNMP walk to JSON transforms the obtained data to JSON

Resulting values:

    [
    {"{#SNMPINDEX}":"7","{#IFALIAS}":"Uplink PT","{#IFTYPE}":"6"},
    {"{#SNMPINDEX}": "8","{#IFALIAS}": "Uplink FB","{#IFTYPE}":"6"},
    {"{#SNMPINDEX}": "473","{#IFALIAS}":"lag","{#IFTYPE}":"161"}
    ]

Once the data is converted to JSON, we can use SNMP walk value preprocessing step together with LLD macros, to create dependent item prototypes:

[Image 9]SNMP walk value preprocessing step can be used to specify value for extraction in item prototypes

### Support of data collection for outdated proxies

To improve the Zabbix component upgrade workflows (especially for large environments), outdated proxies can still perform data collection with a newer Zabbix server version:

  * Proxy is fully supported if it has the same major version as the Zabbix server
  * Proxy is marked as outdated if its major version is older than the Zabbix server but not older than the previous LTS release
  * Outdated proxies still support data collection and remote command execution
  * In other scenarios, the proxy becomes not supported

[Image 10]Deployed proxy compatibility can be seen in Zabbix frontend Server version Current proxy version Outdated proxy version Unsupported proxy version  
6.4 6.4 6.0, 6.2 Older than 6.0; newer than 6.4  
7.0 7.0 6.0, 6.2, 6.4 Older than 6.0; newer than 7.0  
7.2 7.2 7.0 Older than 7.0; newer than 7.2  

### New menu layout 

Zabbix menu layout has been redesigned. The goal of the new menu layout is to provide logical and consistent access to main Zabbix features.

[Image 11]The new menu provides a more consistent and logical layout to Zabbix features

### Real-time streaming of metrics and events over HTTP

In addition to streaming collected metrics and events to files, Zabbix 6.4 adds the option to stream metrics and events over HTTP. Zabbix administrators have the option to filter the data for streaming by using tag filters. A new Connectors section has been introduced under Administration – General. Here Zabbix administrators can define an external system where item values and events should be pushed to.

[Image 12]Define a new connector to stream metrics and events over HTTP

Zabbix 6.4 can be used as a source of information for other applications, analytics reports, and AI engines by streaming metrics and events over HTTP in real time. Metrics and events can be streamed to message brokers like Kafka, RabbitMQ, or Amazon Kinesis to adapt the behavior of external system s in real time. 

### Template versioning 

Template versioning has been introduced to improve template management and ease of use. Templates are now marked with vendor ar version fields, which are visible in Zabbix frontend; these fields can also be added when writing a custom template.

[Image 13]Template version and vendor fields are visible in the frontend

### Development framework for Zabbix widget creation 

Zabbix has a large developer community creating their own custom frontend modules, widgets and Go plugins. In Zabbix 6.4, our goal was to streamline this process by creating a development framework for widget creation. To achieve this, the following changes have been introduced:

  * Widgets have been converted to modules
  * Modules are now fully self-contained and modular
  * Built-in widgets reside in ui/widgets
  * Custom widgets reside in ui/modules/<widget>
  * Adding new widgets is as simple as adding new files without changing the existing files

In addition to these changes, we have also added a new Developer Center section to our documentation. The section contains guides, tutorials and code examples to guide our community in developing Frontend modules and widgets, as well as help with Zabbix agent 2 custom Go plugin development.

[Image 14]The Developer Center section contains guides, tutorials, and code examples for extending Zabbix

### Other features and improvements 

The release includes many other changes:

  * Simple check, External check, SSH agent, Telnet agent item types now do not require an interface to be present on the host 
  * Pre-configured email media type settings for Gmail and O365 email providers 
  * Dynamic item value widget thresholds
  * Option to define custom labeled links for hosts and events
  * Ability to label trigger URLs
  * Improved preprocessing performance and thread-based preprocessing workers
  * Ability to label aggregated datasets in Graph widget
  * SQLite3 Zabbix proxies now automatically recreate the SQLite3 database file during an upgrade
  * A host status filter (enabled/disabled) has been added under Data collection – Hosts
  * Additional filtering options have been added to the Action log
  * Action log now supports import to CSV
  * Multiple context menu improvements to Host, Item and Event context menus
  * Old password verification is now required when changing your internal Zabbix user password
  * Value cache performance improvements when working with metrics that get updated less frequently than once per day
  * Added commands to enable profiling of rwlocks/mutexes (for debugging)

The full list of changes, bug fixes, and new features can be found in 【14†the Zabbix 6.4 release notes†www.zabbix.com】

## New templates and integrations

Zabbix 6.4 comes pre-packaged with many new templates and integrations for the most popular vendors and cloud providers. Multiple existing templates have also received improvements:

  * Microsoft Azure MySQL servers 
  * Microsoft Azure PostgreSQL servers 
  * Microsoft Azure virtual machines 
  * Low-level discovery improvements in AWS by HTTP template 
  * Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager 
  * Veeam Backup and Replication 
  * Cisco Nexus 9000 Series 
  * BMC Control-M 
  * Cisco Meraki dashboard 
  * OS processes by Zabbix agent 
  * Improvements to filesystem discovery in official Zabbix OS templates 

Zabbix 6.4 introduces a webhook integration for the Line messaging app, allowing Zabbix events to be forwarded to the Line messenger. 

[Image 15]Zabbix 6.4 adds a variety of new templates and integrations

## Zabbix 6.4 packages and images

Official Zabbix packages and images are available for: 

  * Linux distributions for different hardware platforms on RHEL, CentOS, Oracle Linux, Debian, SUSE, Ubuntu, Raspbian 
  * Virtualization platforms based on VMWare, VirtualBox, Hyper-V, XEN 
  * Docker 
  * Packages and pre-compiled agents for the most popular platforms, including macOS and MSI packages for Microsoft Windows 

You can find the download instructions and download the new version on the 【15†Download page†www.zabbix.com】.

One-click deployments for the following cloud platforms are coming soon: 

  * AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform, Digital Ocean 

## Upgrading to Zabbix 6.4

In order to upgrade to Zabbix 6.4 you need to upgrade your repository package and download and install the new Zabbix component packages (Zabbix server, proxy, frontend, and other Zabbix components). When you start the Zabbix server, an automatic database schema upgrade will be performed. Zabbix agents are backward compatible; therefore, it is not required to install the new agent versions. You can perform the agent upgrade at a later time. 

If you’re using the 【16†official Docker container images†hub.docker.com】 – simply deploy a new set of containers for your Zabbix components. Once the Zabbix server container connects to the backend database, the database upgrade will be performed automatically.

You can find detailed step-by-step upgrade instructions on our 【17†Upgrade procedure†www.zabbix.com】 page. 

## Join the webinar

  * Default ProxyConfigFrequency parameter is 10 seconds (down from 1 hour)

This also improves the performance of Zabbix servers and proxies, since only configuration deltas are synced. As for active agents – the active agent receives a full configuration copy only when any changes are detected in the configuration instead of receiving it every RefreshActiveChecks interval (old behavior)

### New SNMP walk item for bulk collection and discovery of SNMP metrics 

A new SNMP agent walk item has been introduced. The item looks at a specified OID or OIDs and polls their indexes by suing the SNMP GetBulk requests. An SNMP GetBulk request can provide better performance and more rapid metric collection and discovery from enterprise-tier SNMP devices.

For example:

    walk[1.3.6.1.1,1.3.6.2]

Result:

    1.3.6.1.2.1.1 = STRING: "<value1>"
    1.3.6.1.2.1.2 = STRING: "<value2>"
    1.3.6.1.2.1.3 = STRING: "<value3>"
    1.3.6.2.1 = INTEGER: 10
    1.3.6.2.2 = INTEGER: 20

Textual values can then be transformed to JSON, which can serve as a master item for low-level discovery rules:

[Image 8]SNMP walk to JSON transforms the obtained data to JSON

Resulting values:

    [
    {"{#SNMPINDEX}":"7","{#IFALIAS}":"Uplink PT","{#IFTYPE}":"6"},
    {"{#SNMPINDEX}": "8","{#IFALIAS}": "Uplink FB","{#IFTYPE}":"6"},
    {"{#SNMPINDEX}": "473","{#IFALIAS}":"lag","{#IFTYPE}":"161"}
    ]

Once the data is converted to JSON, we can use SNMP walk value preprocessing step together with LLD macros, to create dependent item prototypes:

[Image 9]SNMP walk value preprocessing step can be used to specify value for extraction in item prototypes

### Support of data collection for outdated proxies

To improve the Zabbix component upgrade workflows (especially for large environments), outdated proxies can still perform data collection with a newer Zabbix server version:

  * Proxy is fully supported if it has the same major version as the Zabbix server
  * Proxy is marked as outdated if its major version is older than the Zabbix server but not older than the previous LTS release
  * Outdated proxies still support data collection and remote command execution
  * In other scenarios, the proxy becomes not supported

[Image 10]Deployed proxy compatibility can be seen in Zabbix frontend Server version Current proxy version Outdated proxy version Unsupported proxy version  
6.4 6.4 6.0, 6.2 Older than 6.0; newer than 6.4  
7.0 7.0 6.0, 6.2, 6.4 Older than 6.0; newer than 7.0  
7.2 7.2 7.0 Older than 7.0; newer than 7.2  

### New menu layout 

Zabbix menu layout has been redesigned. The goal of the new menu layout is to provide logical and consistent access to main Zabbix features.

[Image 11]The new menu provides a more consistent and logical layout to Zabbix features

### Real-time streaming of metrics and events over HTTP

In addition to streaming collected metrics and events to files, Zabbix 6.4 adds the option to stream metrics and events over HTTP. Zabbix administrators have the option to filter the data for streaming by using tag filters. A new Connectors section has been introduced under Administration – General. Here Zabbix administrators can define an external system where item values and events should be pushed to.

[Image 12]Define a new connector to stream metrics and events over HTTP

Zabbix 6.4 can be used as a source of information for other applications, analytics reports, and AI engines by streaming metrics and events over HTTP in real time. Metrics and events can be streamed to message brokers like Kafka, RabbitMQ, or Amazon Kinesis to adapt the behavior of external system s in real time. 

### Template versioning 

Template versioning has been introduced to improve template management and ease of use. Templates are now marked with vendor ar version fields, which are visible in Zabbix frontend; these fields can also be added when writing a custom template.

[Image 13]Template version and vendor fields are visible in the frontend

### Development framework for Zabbix widget creation 

Zabbix has a large developer community creating their own custom frontend modules, widgets and Go plugins. In Zabbix 6.4, our goal was to streamline this process by creating a development framework for widget creation. To achieve this, the following changes have been introduced:

  * Widgets have been converted to modules
  * Modules are now fully self-contained and modular
  * Built-in widgets reside in ui/widgets
  * Custom widgets reside in ui/modules/<widget>
  * Adding new widgets is as simple as adding new files without changing the existing files

In addition to these changes, we have also added a new Developer Center section to our documentation. The section contains guides, tutorials and code examples to guide our community in developing Frontend modules and widgets, as well as help with Zabbix agent 2 custom Go plugin development.

[Image 14]The Developer Center section contains guides, tutorials, and code examples for extending Zabbix

### Other features and improvements 

The release includes many other changes:

  * Simple check, External check, SSH agent, Telnet agent item types now do not require an interface to be present on the host 
  * Pre-configured email media type settings for Gmail and O365 email providers 
  * Dynamic item value widget thresholds
  * Option to define custom labeled links for hosts and events
  * Ability to label trigger URLs
  * Improved preprocessing performance and thread-based preprocessing workers
  * Ability to label aggregated datasets in Graph widget
  * SQLite3 Zabbix proxies now automatically recreate the SQLite3 database file during an upgrade
  * A host status filter (enabled/disabled) has been added under Data collection – Hosts
  * Additional filtering options have been added to the Action log
  * Action log now supports import to CSV
  * Multiple context menu improvements to Host, Item and Event context menus
  * Old password verification is now required when changing your internal Zabbix user password
  * Value cache performance improvements when working with metrics that get updated less frequently than once per day
  * Added commands to enable profiling of rwlocks/mutexes (for debugging)

The full list of changes, bug fixes, and new features can be found in 【14†the Zabbix 6.4 release notes†www.zabbix.com】

## New templates and integrations

Zabbix 6.4 comes pre-packaged with many new templates and integrations for the most popular vendors and cloud providers. Multiple existing templates have also received improvements:

  * Microsoft Azure MySQL servers 
  * Microsoft Azure PostgreSQL servers 
  * Microsoft Azure virtual machines 
  * Low-level discovery improvements in AWS by HTTP template 
  * Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager 
  * Veeam Backup and Replication 
  * Cisco Nexus 9000 Series 
  * BMC Control-M 
  * Cisco Meraki dashboard 
  * OS processes by Zabbix agent 
  * Improvements to filesystem discovery in official Zabbix OS templates 

Zabbix 6.4 introduces a webhook integration for the Line messaging app, allowing Zabbix events to be forwarded to the Line messenger. 

[Image 15]Zabbix 6.4 adds a variety of new templates and integrations

## Zabbix 6.4 packages and images

Official Zabbix packages and images are available for: 

  * Linux distributions for different hardware platforms on RHEL, CentOS, Oracle Linux, Debian, SUSE, Ubuntu, Raspbian 
  * Virtualization platforms based on VMWare, VirtualBox, Hyper-V, XEN 
  * Docker 
  * Packages and pre-compiled agents for the most popular platforms, including macOS and MSI packages for Microsoft Windows 

You can find the download instructions and download the new version on the 【15†Download page†www.zabbix.com】.

One-click deployments for the following cloud platforms are coming soon: 

  * AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform, Digital Ocean 

## Upgrading to Zabbix 6.4

In order to upgrade to Zabbix 6.4 you need to upgrade your repository package and download and install the new Zabbix component packages (Zabbix server, proxy, frontend, and other Zabbix components). When you start the Zabbix server, an automatic database schema upgrade will be performed. Zabbix agents are backward compatible; therefore, it is not required to install the new agent versions. You can perform the agent upgrade at a later time. 

If you’re using the 【16†official Docker container images†hub.docker.com】 – simply deploy a new set of containers for your Zabbix components. Once the Zabbix server container connects to the backend database, the database upgrade will be performed automatically.

You can find detailed step-by-step upgrade instructions on our 【17†Upgrade procedure†www.zabbix.com】 page. 

## Join the webinar

# Integrate Zabbix with your data pipelines by configuring real-time metric and event streaming

[Image 1] By 【13†Arturs Lontons】 April 28, 2023 

Modern IT infrastructures tend to utilize multiple data sources to evaluate and react to the current state of the infrastructure. A set of internal solutions and dedicated software tools are used to correlate the collected information and react in a proper way to changes in the environment – be it a gradual increase or decrease in resource usage, unexpected load spikes or run-of-the-mill outages.

With the release of Zabbix 6.4, metrics collected by Zabbix and events generated based on trigger expressions can be integrated into such a data pipeline by using the new real-time metric and event streaming feature.

Table of Contents

  * Zabbix real-time metric and event streaming 
  * Connectors 
  * Protocol 
  * Use cases

## Zabbix real-time metric and event streaming

Before Zabbix 6.4 Zabbix supported real-time export of history, trends and events to files. The export was performed by exporting the data in newline-delimited JSON format. Additional scripting was mandatory if a user wanted to integrate this data within their data pipeline since Zabbix only exported the data to files without any further transformations or streaming.

On the other hand – real-time metric streaming can be a lot more flexible when it comes to integrating Zabbix with data pipelines, filtering the required data and securing the connection to the third party endpoint.

In addition to specifying the streaming endpoint URL, Zabbix users can choose between streaming Item values and Events. On top of that, Tag filtering can be used to further narrow down the data that will be streamed to the endpoint.

## Connectors

Real-time item value and event streaming can be configured by accessing the Administration – General – Connectors section. Here Zabbix administrators will have to create connectors and specify what kind of data the connector will be streaming. A single connector can only stream either Item values or events – if you wish to stream both, you will have to define at least two connectors, one for values and the other for events.

[Image 2]Configuring a new connector

Marking the Advanced configuration checkbox enables Zabbix administrators to further configure each individual connector – from specifying the number of concurrent sessions, limiting the number of attempts and specifying the connection Timeout to configuring HTTP proxies and enabling SSL connections.

An HTTP authentication method can also be specified for each connector. It is possible to use one of the following methods:

None – no authentication used;

Basic – basic authentication is used;

NTLM – NTLM (Windows NT LAN Manager) authentication is used;

Kerberos – Kerberos authentication is used;

Digest – Digest authentication is used;

Bearer – Bearer authentication is used.

In addition, the number of pre-forked connector worker instances must be specified in the Zabbix server configuration file in the StartConnectors parameter.

[Image 3]Setting StartConnectors parameter in Zabbix server configuration file

## Protocol

Under the hood, the data is sent over HTTP using 【14†newline-delimited JSON export protocol†www.zabbix.com】.

The following example shows a trigger event for Zabbix agent being unreachable:

    {"clock":1519304285,"ns":123456789,"value":1,"name":"Either Zabbix agent is unreachable on Host B or pollers are too busy on Zabbix Server","severity":3,"eventid":42, "hosts":[{"host":"Host B", "name":"Host B visible"},{"host":"Zabbix Server","name":"Zabbix Server visible"}],"groups":["Group X","Group Y","Group Z","Zabbix servers"],"tags":[{"tag":"availability","value":""},{"tag":"data center","value":"Riga"}]}

Do not get confused by the value field, the value if which will always be 1 for problem events, while for items, it will contain the item value:

    {"host":{"host":"Host B","name":"Host B visible"},"groups":["Group X","Group Y","Group Z"],"item_tags":[{"tag":"foo","value":"test"}],"itemid":4,"name":"CPU Load","clock":1519304285,"ns":123456789,"value":0.1,"type":0}

## Use cases

Finally, what particular use cases can we use the real-time metric streaming feature for? As I mentioned in the introduction, Zabbix item values and events could serve as an additional source of near real-time information about the current system behavior.

For example, we could stream item values and events to message brokers such as Kafka, RabbitMQ or Amazon Kinesis. Combine this with additional automation solutions and your services could dynamically scale (think K8s/Docker containers) depending on the current (or expected) load. Zabbix Kubernetes and Docker container monitoring templates very much complement such an approach.

The streamed data could also be used to gain new insights about the system behavior by streaming it to an AI engine or data lakes/data warehouses for long-term storage and analysis.

parts:
Atualmente, para Zabbix, existem integrações interessantes que envolvem o uso de IA, principalmente através da conexão com outras plataformas de monitoramento e observabilidade, como o Dynatrace. Uma integração específica permite que o Zabbix se conecte ao Dynatrace, enriquecendo o SmartScape do Dynatrace com dados de hosts do Zabbix e permitindo que o motor de IA Davis do Dynatrace processe problemas do Zabbix juntamente com eventos nativos do Dynatrace, em uma solução integrada de AIOps. Essa extensão possibilita o uso do Dynatrace como uma plataforma unificadora para dados de soluções de monitoramento externas, ajudando a eliminar tempestades de eventos e minimizar o esforço gasto na investigação【66†source】.

Além disso, o Zabbix 6.4 introduziu a capacidade de streaming de métricas e eventos em tempo real sobre HTTP, tornando-o uma fonte potencial de informações para outras aplicações, relatórios analíticos e motores de IA. Isso permite que métricas e eventos sejam transmitidos para corretores de mensagens como Kafka, RabbitMQ ou Amazon Kinesis, adaptando o comportamento de sistemas externos em tempo real. Este recurso abre novas possibilidades para a integração de Zabbix com pipelines de dados, filtrando os dados necessários e assegurando a conexão segura ao endpoint de terceiros【68†source】.

Para o Cherwell, as informações específicas sobre integrações de IA não foram encontradas durante a pesquisa. Isso não significa que não existam possibilidades; muitas plataformas ITSM como o Cherwell são projetadas para serem flexíveis e capazes de se integrar com várias soluções através de APIs e webhooks, o que pode incluir aplicações de IA para automação de processos, análise de dados e melhoria da tomada de decisões.

Essas integrações representam uma evolução significativa na maneira como as plataformas de monitoramento podem ser utilizadas, não apenas para a observação e reação a estados de infraestrutura em tempo real, mas também para a análise preditiva e a tomada de decisão estratégica apoiada por IA.

# Zabbix Integration

Monitoring consolidation - eliminate event storms, reduce MTTR using Zabbix hosts data and problems in Dynatrace leveraging Davis AI engine.

Technology by Alanata 

Get started【0†Documentation†alanata.atlassian.net】

[Image 6][Image 7][Image 8][Image 9][Image 10]

arrow-left 

  * Product information 

arrow-right 

## Overview 

Consolidate and integrate your monitoring tools. Alanata Zabbix Integration enables you to connect existing Zabbix monitoring into Dynatrace. Enrich Dynatrace SmartScape with Zabbix hosts, ingest Zabbix problems, and let Davis AI engine process the problems together with native Dynatrace events in an integrated AIOps solution. With this extension, you can use Dynatrace as a unifying platform for data from external monitoring solutions, eliminate event storms, and minimize the effort spent on the investigation.

## Key Features

  * Synchronization
    * Zabbix hosts from monitored groups to Dynatrace custom devices. Extension handles

overlapping of Dynatrace OneAgent and Zabbix * Zabbix Hosts information to Dynatrace Custom devices metadata. This includes Zabbix inventory, IP/Hostname information and other metadata configurable in the extension settings * Host TCP port discovery based on Zabbix items (net.tcp.service, net.tcp.port, net.tcp.listen) * Optional host multiple IP interface discovery (Zabbix template must be added to the Zabbix instance) * Tag synchronization from Zabbix to Dynatrace * Problem data from Zabbix problems to Dynatrace events, including acknowledge information and other properties

  * Filtering

    * Filtering based on host groups
  * Problem metric

    * Metric showing problem count for each device (optional)
  * Context information

    * Dynatrace Environment URL to link Hosts/Custom Devices and problems in Dynatrace with Zabbix hosts and problems

【0†Documentation†alanata.atlassian.net】

# Integrate Zabbix with your data pipelines by configuring real-time metric and event streaming

[Image 1] By 【13†Arturs Lontons】 April 28, 2023 

Modern IT infrastructures tend to utilize multiple data sources to evaluate and react to the current state of the infrastructure. A set of internal solutions and dedicated software tools are used to correlate the collected information and react in a proper way to changes in the environment – be it a gradual increase or decrease in resource usage, unexpected load spikes or run-of-the-mill outages.

With the release of Zabbix 6.4, metrics collected by Zabbix and events generated based on trigger expressions can be integrated into such a data pipeline by using the new real-time metric and event streaming feature.

Table of Contents

  * Zabbix real-time metric and event streaming 
  * Connectors 
  * Protocol 
  * Use cases

## Zabbix real-time metric and event streaming

Before Zabbix 6.4 Zabbix supported real-time export of history, trends and events to files. The export was performed by exporting the data in newline-delimited JSON format. Additional scripting was mandatory if a user wanted to integrate this data within their data pipeline since Zabbix only exported the data to files without any further transformations or streaming.

On the other hand – real-time metric streaming can be a lot more flexible when it comes to integrating Zabbix with data pipelines, filtering the required data and securing the connection to the third party endpoint.

In addition to specifying the streaming endpoint URL, Zabbix users can choose between streaming Item values and Events. On top of that, Tag filtering can be used to further narrow down the data that will be streamed to the endpoint.

## Connectors

Real-time item value and event streaming can be configured by accessing the Administration – General – Connectors section. Here Zabbix administrators will have to create connectors and specify what kind of data the connector will be streaming. A single connector can only stream either Item values or events – if you wish to stream both, you will have to define at least two connectors, one for values and the other for events.

[Image 2]Configuring a new connector

Marking the Advanced configuration checkbox enables Zabbix administrators to further configure each individual connector – from specifying the number of concurrent sessions, limiting the number of attempts and specifying the connection Timeout to configuring HTTP proxies and enabling SSL connections.

An HTTP authentication method can also be specified for each connector. It is possible to use one of the following methods:

None – no authentication used;

Basic – basic authentication is used;

NTLM – NTLM (Windows NT LAN Manager) authentication is used;

Kerberos – Kerberos authentication is used;

Digest – Digest authentication is used;

Bearer – Bearer authentication is used.

In addition, the number of pre-forked connector worker instances must be specified in the Zabbix server configuration file in the StartConnectors parameter.

[Image 3]Setting StartConnectors parameter in Zabbix server configuration file

## Protocol

Under the hood, the data is sent over HTTP using 【14†newline-delimited JSON export protocol†www.zabbix.com】.

The following example shows a trigger event for Zabbix agent being unreachable:

    {"clock":1519304285,"ns":123456789,"value":1,"name":"Either Zabbix agent is unreachable on Host B or pollers are too busy on Zabbix Server","severity":3,"eventid":42, "hosts":[{"host":"Host B", "name":"Host B visible"},{"host":"Zabbix Server","name":"Zabbix Server visible"}],"groups":["Group X","Group Y","Group Z","Zabbix servers"],"tags":[{"tag":"availability","value":""},{"tag":"data center","value":"Riga"}]}

Do not get confused by the value field, the value if which will always be 1 for problem events, while for items, it will contain the item value:

    {"host":{"host":"Host B","name":"Host B visible"},"groups":["Group X","Group Y","Group Z"],"item_tags":[{"tag":"foo","value":"test"}],"itemid":4,"name":"CPU Load","clock":1519304285,"ns":123456789,"value":0.1,"type":0}

## Use cases

Finally, what particular use cases can we use the real-time metric streaming feature for? As I mentioned in the introduction, Zabbix item values and events could serve as an additional source of near real-time information about the current system behavior.

For example, we could stream item values and events to message brokers such as Kafka, RabbitMQ or Amazon Kinesis. Combine this with additional automation solutions and your services could dynamically scale (think K8s/Docker containers) depending on the current (or expected) load. Zabbix Kubernetes and Docker container monitoring templates very much complement such an approach.

The streamed data could also be used to gain new insights about the system behavior by streaming it to an AI engine or data lakes/data warehouses for long-term storage and analysis.

# Ivanti to integrate Cherwell ITSM Solutions with Ivanti Neurons Platform to Deliver Superior Employee Experiences in the Everywhere Workplace

### Ivanti Neurons innovation roadmap and enhancements personalize and contextualize employee experiences with self-service, self-heal and self-secure capabilities

SALT LAKE CITY — June 03, 2021 —

【9†Ivanti,】 the automation platform that discovers, manages, secures, and services IT assets from cloud to edge, today announced its vision for the convergence of Ivanti and Cherwell solutions, continuing its plans to layer on hyper-automation with the Ivanti Neurons platform to self-service, self-heal and self-secure the Everywhere Workplace. Every line of business can now benefit from the combination of technologies from Ivanti and Cherwell and apply hyper-automation to deal with increased IT demand and complexity in today’s hybrid and remote work environment.

Ivanti acquired Cherwell in March 2021 to expand the reach of its Ivanti Neurons platform, and to help cement Ivanti’s position as one of the only enterprise service management vendors to offer end-to-end service and asset management from IT to lines of business and from every endpoint to the IoT edge. With a converged roadmap, Ivanti is integrating the platforms and introducing innovations in a way that will benefit both Ivanti and Cherwell customers.

“Integrating Cherwell with the Ivanti Neurons solutions has already benefitted existing Cherwell customers in a number of ways,” said Nayaki Nayyar, President, Service Management Solutions, and Chief Product Officer at Ivanti. “Through the introduction of self-healing, self-securing and improved self-service capabilities to the Cherwell solutions, we have accelerated the roadmap significantly. We are committed to the success of every customer, and they can also expect to benefit from a more frequent and regular cadence of product releases.”

“The potential uses for service management tools has evolved past its roots in IT support,” said Adam Holtby, Principal Analyst at Omdia. “As covered in our recent report on Enterprise Service Management, the acquisitions made by Ivanti have significantly strengthened its offering and the way that it supports digital workspace initiatives.”

For full details on the Ivanti product roadmap, join 【10†Ivanti Solutions Summit】, being held June 7-9, to do a deep dive and interact directly with product leaders. There will also be opportunities to hear from customers about how the combined solution portfolio has contributed to their success.

About Ivanti

Ivanti makes the Everywhere Workplace possible. In the Everywhere Workplace, employees use myriad devices to access IT applications and data over various networks to stay productive as they work from anywhere. The Ivanti Neurons automation platform connects the company’s industry-leading unified endpoint management, zero trust security and enterprise service management solutions, providing a unified IT platform that enables devices to self-heal and self-secure and empowers users to self-service. Over 40,000 customers, including 78 of the Fortune 100, have chosen Ivanti to discover, manage, secure, and service their IT assets from cloud to edge, and deliver excellent end user experiences for employees, wherever and however they work. For more information, visit 【9†www.ivanti.com】 and follow @GoIvanti.

#### Press Contacts

Carrie Laudie  
Ivanti  
Associate Director, Public Relations  
+1 650-963-6011  
【11†[email protected]】
Visible: 0% - 100%

content.text:
ServiceNow’s strengths lie in its focus on digital transformation, end-to-end capabilities, and its role as a platform for various business processes beyond ITSM. 

## A Comparison Chart of ServiceNow vs Cherwell

Operating the landscape of IT Service Management (ITSM) solutions demands a meticulous evaluation of the standout players. 

ServiceNow and Cherwell are two prominent contenders in the realm of ITSM. Each of these platforms has different capabilities, deployment options, and alignment with industry needs.

Below is a detailed comparison chart highlighting key aspects of ServiceNow and Cherwell, aiding in your evaluation of these ITSM solutions:

Aspect ServiceNow Cherwell   
Deployment Cloud-based On-premises, cloud, or hybrid   
Pricing Model Subscription-based Pricing varies based on deployment and modules   
ITSM Capabilities Comprehensive suite covering ITSM and beyond Focus on core ITSM processes   
User Interface Modern and intuitive User-friendly with customizable UI   
Automation Advanced workflow automation and orchestration Workflow automation with customizable flows   
Asset Management Integrated IT asset and configuration management IT asset lifecycle management   
AI and Analytics AI-powered predictive insights and analytics Reporting and analytics tools   
Integration Extensive third-party integrations and APIs Integration capabilities with APIs   
Scalability Highly scalable for large enterprises Scalable for varying organizational sizes   
Employee Experience Employee self-service, HR service delivery Self-service portal and IT support   
Customization Highly customizable workflows and processes Codeless customization and configuration   
Vendor Reputation Industry leader with a wide customer base Strong reputation for ITSM solutions   
Market Presence Widely used across various industries Gaining popularity in ITSM market   
ITIL Alignment Strong alignment with ITIL best practices Supports ITIL framework  

As the dust settles on the comparison of ServiceNow and Cherwell, it’s evident that both platforms offer distinct advantages for diverse organizational needs. 

ServiceNow’s comprehensive suite extends beyond ITSM, making it a robust choice for holistic digital transformation. Cherwell focuses on core ITSM functions while offering flexibility and customization. 

The optimal choice hinges on your organization’s priorities, objectives, and specific requirements. 

## What Are the Similarities and Differences Between Cherwell and ServiceNow?

In the intricate realm of IT Service Management (ITSM), the choice between Cherwell and ServiceNow can be pivotal. 

Let’s trace out the core aspects where these two platforms converge and diverge, shedding light on their shared attributes and unique characteristics.

### Similarities Between Cherwell and ServiceNow

The similarities you will find between ServiceNow and Cherwell are discussed in detail below –

1. IT Service Management Focus: Cherwell and ServiceNow center their offerings around streamlining IT Service Management processes, encompassing incident handling, request management, problem resolution, and change management.

2. User-Centric Design: A user-friendly approach characterizes both platforms, evident through intuitive interfaces and self-service portals that empower end-users to engage effortlessly with IT services.

3. Customization Empowerment: Cherwell and ServiceNow acknowledge the diverse needs of organizations by providing customization options, allowing workflows, forms, and processes to be tailored according to specific requirements.

4. Automation Capabilities: Workflow automation stands as a shared strength, as both platforms facilitate the automation of routine tasks, fostering operational efficiency and minimizing manual intervention.

5. Integration Flexibility: The seamless integration with third-party tools and applications is a common feature, enabling cross-platform collaboration and optimizing overall IT ecosystem functionality.

### Differences Between Cherwell and ServiceNow

Cherwell and Sertvicenow, being each other’s prime competitors, illustrate dissimilarities in the following ways – 

1. Deployment Options: Cherwell offers the flexibility of on-premises, cloud, or hybrid deployment, while ServiceNow primarily operates as a cloud-based platform, promoting scalability and accessibility.

2. Scope of Solutions: Cherwell concentrates on core ITSM functions, while ServiceNow extends its reach to encompass a broader suite, spanning IT Operations Management, HR service delivery, and customer service management.

3. AI and Analytics: While Cherwell has limited AI capabilities, ServiceNow integrates advanced artificial intelligence and machine learning for predictive insights and intelligent automation.

4. Vendor Reputation: Cherwell is known for its user-friendly interface and commendable customer support, while ServiceNow boasts a dominant position in the industry with a vast customer base spanning various sectors.

5. Customization Approach: Cherwell’s strength lies in codeless customization and configuration, while ServiceNow provides an extensive range of customization options, accommodating diverse organizational needs.

6. Market Presence: Cherwell is progressively gaining traction in the ITSM market, whereas ServiceNow has firmly established its presence and is widely adopted across industries.

7. Employee Experience Focus: Cherwell centers on a self-service portal and IT support, whereas ServiceNow prioritizes the employee experience by extending its features to encompass HR service delivery and employee self-service.

ServiceNow and Cherwell – both of these platforms possess unique strengths that can cater to specific organizational requirements. 

By understanding these parallels and distinctions, you’ll be better equipped to make an informed decision, aligning your choice with the distinct needs and aspirations of your IT Service Management endeavors.

## Why Consider Pricing: Cherwell vs ServiceNow?

In the decision-making process of selecting an ITSM solution, understanding pricing nuances holds undeniable importance. 

Let’s observe the pricing aspects of Cherwell and ServiceNow, deciphering how their cost structures impact businesses of varying sizes.

### Cherwell’s Pricing Approach

While Cherwell’s pricing may not be as openly showcased, it caters to diverse business dimensions. The tool extends a helping hand to small businesses with a comparatively reasonable pricing model. 

Plans are available, with prices scaling to $150 per three individuals, providing a comprehensive package encompassing essential features. Certain components might be available as separate add-ons.

### ServiceNow’s Pricing Insight

ServiceNow’s pricing strategy signifies its focus on larger enterprises. Offering adaptable deals to suit varying needs, the tool’s pricing can be tailored. ServiceNow solution leans toward the higher end of the cost spectrum. 

Especially when considering the Now Platform service, the expenses can be substantial. This makes it prudent for smaller businesses to explore alternatives with more budget-friendly options.

It’s evident that Cherwell’s approach provides a more accommodating framework for small businesses, making it an attractive choice for budget-conscious ventures. ServiceNow’s pricing strategy positions it as a solution better suited for enterprises with robust financial capabilities. 

The decision rests on aligning your organization’s financial resources with the solution that meets your ITSM needs and within your budgetary boundaries.

## What Are the Pros and Cons of Cherwell and ServiceNow? 

Selecting the right IT Service Management (ITSM) solution requires a comprehensive understanding of each platform’s advantages and drawbacks. Let’s determine the pros and cons of Cherwell and ServiceNow to provide a balanced view of your decision-making process.

### Pros and Cons of Cherwell

The pros of using Cherwell are given below –

  * Cherwell boasts an intuitive UI that eases user adoption and minimizes training efforts.
  * Extensive customization options enable tailoring workflows, forms, and processes to unique organizational needs.
  * Cherwell accommodates on-premises, cloud, and hybrid deployment, providing versatility in implementation.
  * Cherwell’s pricing structure suits smaller budgets, making it a viable option for startups and growing businesses.

When using Cherwell, you might encounter the following cons –

  * Cherwell’s AI features are less advanced compared to competitors like ServiceNow.
  * Cherwell, while gaining traction, still holds a smaller market presence compared to more established solutions.

### Pros and Cons of ServiceNow

By using ServiceNow, anyone can have the following pros –

  * ServiceNow offers a broad range of services, extending beyond ITSM to ITOM, HR, and customer service management.
  * Advanced AI and machine learning capabilities enhance predictive insights, automation, and decision-making.
  * ServiceNow’s market dominance and widespread use reflect its established reputation as an industry leader.

The following two are the cons of using ServiceNow as an ITSM solution –

  * ServiceNow’s robust features are often accompanied by a higher price tag, potentially limiting accessibility for smaller organizations.
  * The extensive capabilities of ServiceNow may lead to a steeper learning curve for users and administrators.

Remember that the “perfect” solution varies based on your organization’s needs, goals, and budget. By meticulously evaluating the merits and drawbacks of each platform, you’ll be empowered to make an informed decision that aligns with your unique ITSM requirements.

## Which 3 Things Should You Consider to Choose the Right ITSM Solution for You?

Embarking on the journey to find the perfect IT Service Management (ITSM) solution demands a meticulous evaluation tailored to your organization’s unique needs. Here are three pivotal factors, intricately detailed for your understanding:

[Image 3: 3 Things Should You Consider to Choose the Right ITSM Solution for You?]

### 1. Business Requirements Alignment

In your quest to select the right ITSM solution, aligning the solution with your business requirements is a crucial starting point. Dive into these facets:

  * Ascertain the full scope of your organization’s operations. Uncover the number of users, devices, and services involved. 
  * Inquire about the intricacies of your IT processes. Whether it’s incident management, problem resolution, or change management, comprehending the complexity of each process is essential.
  * Understand the nature of the services you provide. Whether it’s internal IT support or external customer service, the ITSM solution must align with the specific functionalities.

### 2. Scalability and Future Growth

Anticipating the future growth and scalability of your organization is paramount. Let’s explore this dimension in detail:

  * Peer into the future and envision the growth trajectory of your organization. Consider factors like user demand, service requests, and data volume.
  * Ensure that scalability doesn’t compromise performance. The solution must seamlessly scale without sacrificing responsiveness.

# Enterprise Service Management Software 

Cherwell Service Management is a comprehensive service desk solution verified for eleven ITIL® processes. Meet changing and growing demands across the organization, all with fewer headaches and lower costs.

##### 

## Flexible, feature-rich ITSM software 

###### 

Improve service delivery with eleven ITIL® processes, codeless configuration, flexible portals, and powerful dashboards. Easy administration, extensibility, quick upgrades, inclusive licensing, and a vibrant user community accelerates time to value, while reducing total cost of ownership.

【9†View the Datasheet】

[Image 1: cherwell itsm]

##### Complete IT Service Desk 

Integrated processes on common platform and shared Configuration Management Database (CMDB).

###### 

##### Comprehensive ITIL Processes 

Leverage the eleven most commonly used ITIL® processes, all verified.

###### 

##### Incident and Request Management 

Submit and fulfill requests, report issues, check status, and remediate incidents.

###### 

##### Change Management 

Simplify the configuration and experience of one of the most strategic ITSM processes.

###### 

##### Configuration Management 

Centrally manage Configuration Items, and visualize relationships.

###### 

##### IT Asset Management 

Track and manage the life cycle of supported hardware and software assets.

###### 

##### Discovery and Dependency Mapping 

Full visibility and automated CMDB updates for more effective IT operations.

###### 

##### Omni-Channel Engagement 

Enhance employee experiences for service requests or reporting and checking incident status.

##

Extend your capabilities with pre-built integrations using mApps (merge-able applications) from the Cherwell Marketplace.

parts:
A integração do Cherwell ITSM com plataformas de IA e automação está em curso, especialmente por meio da sua aquisição pela Ivanti. A Ivanti está integrando as soluções Cherwell com a plataforma Ivanti Neurons para fornecer experiências aprimoradas aos funcionários em ambientes de trabalho diversificados. Essa integração foca em hiper-automação com capacidades de autoatendimento, auto-cura e auto-segurança, o que beneficia tanto clientes Ivanti quanto Cherwell, acelerando o caminho do produto com inovações significativas【74†source】.

Comparativamente, enquanto o Cherwell foca em funções essenciais de ITSM e oferece flexibilidade e customização, a integração de IA e análises ainda é limitada em comparação com plataformas como o ServiceNow, que integra inteligência artificial e aprendizado de máquina avançados para insights preditivos e automação inteligente【75†source】. 

O Cherwell Service Management é descrito como uma solução abrangente de gerenciamento de serviços que suporta onze processos ITIL® e oferece gestão de incidentes e solicitações, gerenciamento de mudanças, gerenciamento de configurações, e gerenciamento de ativos de TI. A solução promete flexibilidade com configuração sem código, portais flexíveis, e painéis poderosos, visando a melhoria na entrega de serviços com custos reduzidos e administração fácil【76†source】.

Para explorar mais sobre as capacidades e integrações de IA específicas do Zabbix, é sugerido revisitar recursos e documentações oficiais, dado que sua natureza de código aberto e ampla comunidade podem oferecer inúmeras possibilidades de integrações customizadas que aproveitam tecnologias de IA para análise de dados e automação de monitoramento.

Para obter detalhes completos sobre as integrações de IA disponíveis e como elas podem ser aplicadas para aprimorar a gestão de serviços de TI e operações na PMESP, recomenda-se a consulta direta aos recursos fornecidos pelos fornecedores e a participação em eventos informativos como o Ivanti Solutions Summit mencionado.

# Ivanti to integrate Cherwell ITSM Solutions with Ivanti Neurons Platform to Deliver Superior Employee Experiences in the Everywhere Workplace

### Ivanti Neurons innovation roadmap and enhancements personalize and contextualize employee experiences with self-service, self-heal and self-secure capabilities

SALT LAKE CITY — June 03, 2021 —

【9†Ivanti,】 the automation platform that discovers, manages, secures, and services IT assets from cloud to edge, today announced its vision for the convergence of Ivanti and Cherwell solutions, continuing its plans to layer on hyper-automation with the Ivanti Neurons platform to self-service, self-heal and self-secure the Everywhere Workplace. Every line of business can now benefit from the combination of technologies from Ivanti and Cherwell and apply hyper-automation to deal with increased IT demand and complexity in today’s hybrid and remote work environment.

Ivanti acquired Cherwell in March 2021 to expand the reach of its Ivanti Neurons platform, and to help cement Ivanti’s position as one of the only enterprise service management vendors to offer end-to-end service and asset management from IT to lines of business and from every endpoint to the IoT edge. With a converged roadmap, Ivanti is integrating the platforms and introducing innovations in a way that will benefit both Ivanti and Cherwell customers.

“Integrating Cherwell with the Ivanti Neurons solutions has already benefitted existing Cherwell customers in a number of ways,” said Nayaki Nayyar, President, Service Management Solutions, and Chief Product Officer at Ivanti. “Through the introduction of self-healing, self-securing and improved self-service capabilities to the Cherwell solutions, we have accelerated the roadmap significantly. We are committed to the success of every customer, and they can also expect to benefit from a more frequent and regular cadence of product releases.”

“The potential uses for service management tools has evolved past its roots in IT support,” said Adam Holtby, Principal Analyst at Omdia. “As covered in our recent report on Enterprise Service Management, the acquisitions made by Ivanti have significantly strengthened its offering and the way that it supports digital workspace initiatives.”

For full details on the Ivanti product roadmap, join 【10†Ivanti Solutions Summit】, being held June 7-9, to do a deep dive and interact directly with product leaders. There will also be opportunities to hear from customers about how the combined solution portfolio has contributed to their success.

About Ivanti

Ivanti makes the Everywhere Workplace possible. In the Everywhere Workplace, employees use myriad devices to access IT applications and data over various networks to stay productive as they work from anywhere. The Ivanti Neurons automation platform connects the company’s industry-leading unified endpoint management, zero trust security and enterprise service management solutions, providing a unified IT platform that enables devices to self-heal and self-secure and empowers users to self-service. Over 40,000 customers, including 78 of the Fortune 100, have chosen Ivanti to discover, manage, secure, and service their IT assets from cloud to edge, and deliver excellent end user experiences for employees, wherever and however they work. For more information, visit 【9†www.ivanti.com】 and follow @GoIvanti.

#### Press Contacts

Carrie Laudie  
Ivanti  
Associate Director, Public Relations  
+1 650-963-6011  
【11†[email protected]】

As the dust settles on the comparison of ServiceNow and Cherwell, it’s evident that both platforms offer distinct advantages for diverse organizational needs. 

ServiceNow’s comprehensive suite extends beyond ITSM, making it a robust choice for holistic digital transformation. Cherwell focuses on core ITSM functions while offering flexibility and customization. 

The optimal choice hinges on your organization’s priorities, objectives, and specific requirements. 

## What Are the Similarities and Differences Between Cherwell and ServiceNow?

In the intricate realm of IT Service Management (ITSM), the choice between Cherwell and ServiceNow can be pivotal. 

Let’s trace out the core aspects where these two platforms converge and diverge, shedding light on their shared attributes and unique characteristics.

### Similarities Between Cherwell and ServiceNow

The similarities you will find between ServiceNow and Cherwell are discussed in detail below –

1. IT Service Management Focus: Cherwell and ServiceNow center their offerings around streamlining IT Service Management processes, encompassing incident handling, request management, problem resolution, and change management.

2. User-Centric Design: A user-friendly approach characterizes both platforms, evident through intuitive interfaces and self-service portals that empower end-users to engage effortlessly with IT services.

3. Customization Empowerment: Cherwell and ServiceNow acknowledge the diverse needs of organizations by providing customization options, allowing workflows, forms, and processes to be tailored according to specific requirements.

4. Automation Capabilities: Workflow automation stands as a shared strength, as both platforms facilitate the automation of routine tasks, fostering operational efficiency and minimizing manual intervention.

5. Integration Flexibility: The seamless integration with third-party tools and applications is a common feature, enabling cross-platform collaboration and optimizing overall IT ecosystem functionality.

### Differences Between Cherwell and ServiceNow

Cherwell and Sertvicenow, being each other’s prime competitors, illustrate dissimilarities in the following ways – 

1. Deployment Options: Cherwell offers the flexibility of on-premises, cloud, or hybrid deployment, while ServiceNow primarily operates as a cloud-based platform, promoting scalability and accessibility.

2. Scope of Solutions: Cherwell concentrates on core ITSM functions, while ServiceNow extends its reach to encompass a broader suite, spanning IT Operations Management, HR service delivery, and customer service management.

3. AI and Analytics: While Cherwell has limited AI capabilities, ServiceNow integrates advanced artificial intelligence and machine learning for predictive insights and intelligent automation.

4. Vendor Reputation: Cherwell is known for its user-friendly interface and commendable customer support, while ServiceNow boasts a dominant position in the industry with a vast customer base spanning various sectors.

5. Customization Approach: Cherwell’s strength lies in codeless customization and configuration, while ServiceNow provides an extensive range of customization options, accommodating diverse organizational needs.

6. Market Presence: Cherwell is progressively gaining traction in the ITSM market, whereas ServiceNow has firmly established its presence and is widely adopted across industries.

7. Employee Experience Focus: Cherwell centers on a self-service portal and IT support, whereas ServiceNow prioritizes the employee experience by extending its features to encompass HR service delivery and employee self-service.

ServiceNow and Cherwell – both of these platforms possess unique strengths that can cater to specific organizational requirements. 

By understanding these parallels and distinctions, you’ll be better equipped to make an informed decision, aligning your choice with the distinct needs and aspirations of your IT Service Management endeavors.

## Why Consider Pricing: Cherwell vs ServiceNow?

In the decision-making process of selecting an ITSM solution, understanding pricing nuances holds undeniable importance. 

Let’s observe the pricing aspects of Cherwell and ServiceNow, deciphering how their cost structures impact businesses of varying sizes.

### Cherwell’s Pricing Approach

While Cherwell’s pricing may not be as openly showcased, it caters to diverse business dimensions. The tool extends a helping hand to small businesses with a comparatively reasonable pricing model. 

Plans are available, with prices scaling to $150 per three individuals, providing a comprehensive package encompassing essential features. Certain components might be available as separate add-ons.

### ServiceNow’s Pricing Insight

ServiceNow’s pricing strategy signifies its focus on larger enterprises. Offering adaptable deals to suit varying needs, the tool’s pricing can be tailored. ServiceNow solution leans toward the higher end of the cost spectrum. 

Especially when considering the Now Platform service, the expenses can be substantial. This makes it prudent for smaller businesses to explore alternatives with more budget-friendly options.

It’s evident that Cherwell’s approach provides a more accommodating framework for small businesses, making it an attractive choice for budget-conscious ventures. ServiceNow’s pricing strategy positions it as a solution better suited for enterprises with robust financial capabilities. 

The decision rests on aligning your organization’s financial resources with the solution that meets your ITSM needs and within your budgetary boundaries.

## What Are the Pros and Cons of Cherwell and ServiceNow? 

Selecting the right IT Service Management (ITSM) solution requires a comprehensive understanding of each platform’s advantages and drawbacks. Let’s determine the pros and cons of Cherwell and ServiceNow to provide a balanced view of your decision-making process.

### Pros and Cons of Cherwell

The pros of using Cherwell are given below –

  * Cherwell boasts an intuitive UI that eases user adoption and minimizes training efforts.
  * Extensive customization options enable tailoring workflows, forms, and processes to unique organizational needs.
  * Cherwell accommodates on-premises, cloud, and hybrid deployment, providing versatility in implementation.
  * Cherwell’s pricing structure suits smaller budgets, making it a viable option for startups and growing businesses.

When using Cherwell, you might encounter the following cons –

  * Cherwell’s AI features are less advanced compared to competitors like ServiceNow.
  * Cherwell, while gaining traction, still holds a smaller market presence compared to more established solutions.

### Pros and Cons of ServiceNow

By using ServiceNow, anyone can have the following pros –

  * ServiceNow offers a broad range of services, extending beyond ITSM to ITOM, HR, and customer service management.
  * Advanced AI and machine learning capabilities enhance predictive insights, automation, and decision-making.
  * ServiceNow’s market dominance and widespread use reflect its established reputation as an industry leader.

The following two are the cons of using ServiceNow as an ITSM solution –

  * ServiceNow’s robust features are often accompanied by a higher price tag, potentially limiting accessibility for smaller organizations.
  * The extensive capabilities of ServiceNow may lead to a steeper learning curve for users and administrators.

Remember that the “perfect” solution varies based on your organization’s needs, goals, and budget. By meticulously evaluating the merits and drawbacks of each platform, you’ll be empowered to make an informed decision that aligns with your unique ITSM requirements.

## Which 3 Things Should You Consider to Choose the Right ITSM Solution for You?

Embarking on the journey to find the perfect IT Service Management (ITSM) solution demands a meticulous evaluation tailored to your organization’s unique needs. Here are three pivotal factors, intricately detailed for your understanding:

[Image 3: 3 Things Should You Consider to Choose the Right ITSM Solution for You?]

### 1. Business Requirements Alignment

In your quest to select the right ITSM solution, aligning the solution with your business requirements is a crucial starting point. Dive into these facets:

  * Ascertain the full scope of your organization’s operations. Uncover the number of users, devices, and services involved. 
  * Inquire about the intricacies of your IT processes. Whether it’s incident management, problem resolution, or change management, comprehending the complexity of each process is essential.
  * Understand the nature of the services you provide. Whether it’s internal IT support or external customer service, the ITSM solution must align with the specific functionalities.

### 2. Scalability and Future Growth

Anticipating the future growth and scalability of your organization is paramount. Let’s explore this dimension in detail:

  * Peer into the future and envision the growth trajectory of your organization. Consider factors like user demand, service requests, and data volume.
  * Ensure that scalability doesn’t compromise performance. The solution must seamlessly scale without sacrificing responsiveness.

# Ivanti to integrate Cherwell ITSM Solutions with Ivanti Neurons Platform to Deliver Superior Employee Experiences in the Everywhere Workplace

### Ivanti Neurons innovation roadmap and enhancements personalize and contextualize employee experiences with self-service, self-heal and self-secure capabilities

SALT LAKE CITY — June 03, 2021 —

【9†Ivanti,】 the automation platform that discovers, manages, secures, and services IT assets from cloud to edge, today announced its vision for the convergence of Ivanti and Cherwell solutions, continuing its plans to layer on hyper-automation with the Ivanti Neurons platform to self-service, self-heal and self-secure the Everywhere Workplace. Every line of business can now benefit from the combination of technologies from Ivanti and Cherwell and apply hyper-automation to deal with increased IT demand and complexity in today’s hybrid and remote work environment.

Ivanti acquired Cherwell in March 2021 to expand the reach of its Ivanti Neurons platform, and to help cement Ivanti’s position as one of the only enterprise service management vendors to offer end-to-end service and asset management from IT to lines of business and from every endpoint to the IoT edge. With a converged roadmap, Ivanti is integrating the platforms and introducing innovations in a way that will benefit both Ivanti and Cherwell customers.

“Integrating Cherwell with the Ivanti Neurons solutions has already benefitted existing Cherwell customers in a number of ways,” said Nayaki Nayyar, President, Service Management Solutions, and Chief Product Officer at Ivanti. “Through the introduction of self-healing, self-securing and improved self-service capabilities to the Cherwell solutions, we have accelerated the roadmap significantly. We are committed to the success of every customer, and they can also expect to benefit from a more frequent and regular cadence of product releases.”

“The potential uses for service management tools has evolved past its roots in IT support,” said Adam Holtby, Principal Analyst at Omdia. “As covered in our recent report on Enterprise Service Management, the acquisitions made by Ivanti have significantly strengthened its offering and the way that it supports digital workspace initiatives.”

For full details on the Ivanti product roadmap, join 【10†Ivanti Solutions Summit】, being held June 7-9, to do a deep dive and interact directly with product leaders. There will also be opportunities to hear from customers about how the combined solution portfolio has contributed to their success.

About Ivanti

Ivanti makes the Everywhere Workplace possible. In the Everywhere Workplace, employees use myriad devices to access IT applications and data over various networks to stay productive as they work from anywhere. The Ivanti Neurons automation platform connects the company’s industry-leading unified endpoint management, zero trust security and enterprise service management solutions, providing a unified IT platform that enables devices to self-heal and self-secure and empowers users to self-service. Over 40,000 customers, including 78 of the Fortune 100, have chosen Ivanti to discover, manage, secure, and service their IT assets from cloud to edge, and deliver excellent end user experiences for employees, wherever and however they work. For more information, visit 【9†www.ivanti.com】 and follow @GoIvanti.
